ETYMOLOGY: From Old French chastaigne, from Latin castanea, from Ancient Greek kastanon, likely of Anatolian origin.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An edible, starchy nut, typically brownish-red, that grows inside a prickly casing.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种可食用的淀粉类坚果，通常呈红棕色，生长在带刺的外壳中。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We gathered chestnuts in the woods to roast later.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们在树林里收集栗子，准备稍后烤着吃。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A deciduous tree or shrub that produces chestnuts.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种结出栗子的落叶乔木或灌木。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The old chestnut tree in the garden provides excellent shade.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 花园里那棵老栗子树提供了极好的荫凉。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective: a word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She dyed her hair a lovely chestnut color.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她把头发染成了漂亮的栗色。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An old or stale joke, story, or phrase that has been repeated many times and is no longer fresh or original.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一个老掉牙的、反复讲过的笑话、故事或短语，不再新鲜或有创意。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Don't tell that old chestnut about the talking parrot again!
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 别再讲那个关于会说话的鹦鹉的老掉牙的笑话了！
